required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Adjuvant Radiotherapy in Patients With Early Endometrial Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Controlled Trial of Adjuvant Radiotherapy in Patients With Early Endometrial Cancer Based on Moderate Risk Molecules Classification

brief_summary.textblock: To compare the effect of vaginal brachytherapy as adjuvant treatment after operation when compared to pelvic external beam radiotherapy in patients with early endometrial cancer based on moderate risk molecules classification.

detailed_description.textblock: After being informed the study and potential risk，all patients giving written informed consent will be undergo a 1-week screening period determine eligibility for study entry. At week 0, patients who meet the eligibility will be randomized in a 1:1 ratio to vaginal brachytherapy or pelvic external beam radiotherapy. After treatment, patients were followed up regularly.

primary_outcome.description: disease-free survival from being received treatment

secondary_outcome.description: vaginal recurrences; pelvic recurrence; distant metastases
Overall survival from being received treatment

arm_group.description: CT image guided high-dose-rate vaginal brachytherapy, 30Gy/6f, 2f/w.

intervention.description: high-dose-rate vaginal brachytherapy; pelvic external beam radiotherapy
